question_text: Which statement correctly describes rock-forming minerals and economic minerals?

answers.text: Rock-forming minerals consist of a few types of minerals that are abundant in Earth’s crust, whereas economic minerals are less abundant and are used extensively in the manufacture of products. ->
answers.match_pair: Rock-forming minerals consist of a few types of minerals that are abundant in Earth’s crust, whereas economic minerals are less abundant and are used extensively in the manufacture of products. ->

answers.text: Silicates are important economic resources and include gypsum, which is used for plaster. Nonsilicate minerals are only important as rock-building minerals. ->
answers.match_pair: Silicates are important economic resources and include gypsum, which is used for plaster. Nonsilicate minerals are only important as rock-building minerals. ->

answers.text: Economic minerals consist mostly of silicate minerals, whereas rock-building minerals consist mostly of nonsilicates. ->
answers.match_pair: Economic minerals consist mostly of silicate minerals, whereas rock-building minerals consist mostly of nonsilicates. ->

answers.text: Only minerals that are not rock-building minerals can have economic value. ->
answers.match_pair: Only minerals that are not rock-building minerals can have economic value. ->

answers.text: Rock-forming minerals consist of a few types of minerals that are sparse in Earth’s crust, whereas economic minerals are very abundant and are used extensively in the manufacture of products. ->
answers.match_pair: Rock-forming minerals consist of a few types of minerals that are sparse in Earth’s crust, whereas economic minerals are very abundant and are used extensively in the manufacture of products. ->

question_text: Why does quartz have this pyramid shape?

answers.text: This shape results from the ordered crystal structure of SiO2 ->
answers.match_pair: This shape results from the ordered crystal structure of SiO2 ->

answers.text: These are facets cut by humans to make it look nicer. ->
answers.match_pair: These are facets cut by humans to make it look nicer. ->

answers.text: Because any mineral that grows into open space has this shape ->
answers.match_pair: Because any mineral that grows into open space has this shape ->

answers.text: This forms when quartz grows by precipitation from a solution. ->
answers.match_pair: This forms when quartz grows by precipitation from a solution. ->

question_text: How do rocks differ from minerals?

answers.text: Minerals aggregate to form rocks, but rocks do not aggregate to form minerals. ->
answers.match_pair: Minerals aggregate to form rocks, but rocks do not aggregate to form minerals. ->

answers.text: Some minerals contain amorphous glassy debris or organic matter. However, these components are never found in rocks. ->
answers.match_pair: Some minerals contain amorphous glassy debris or organic matter. However, these components are never found in rocks. ->

answers.text: Rocks aggregate to form minerals, but minerals do not aggregate to form rocks. ->
answers.match_pair: Rocks aggregate to form minerals, but minerals do not aggregate to form rocks. ->

answers.text: Minerals can be synthesized, whereas rocks only naturally occur. ->
answers.match_pair: Minerals can be synthesized, whereas rocks only naturally occur. ->

answers.text: Rocks can be synthesized, whereas minerals only naturally occur. ->
answers.match_pair: Rocks can be synthesized, whereas minerals only naturally occur. ->
